comments:
When I try to import files by FTP or WebDAV the following errors occur:

Plug-in org.eclipse.team.webdav was unable to load class org.eclipse.team.internal.webdav.ui.subscriber.WebDavImportWizard.

The same happends when I try to export:

Plug-in org.eclipse.team.webdav was unable to load class org.eclipse.team.internal.webdav.ui.subscriber.WebDavExportWizard.

For ftp import/export as well:

Plug-in org.eclipse.team.ftp was unable to load class org.eclipse.team.internal.ftp.ui.subscriber.FTPImportWizard.

Plug-in org.eclipse.team.ftp was unable to load class org.eclipse.team.internal.ftp.ui.subscriber.FTPExportWizard.


Reproduction:
1. Install FTP and WebDAV via updatemanager.
2. Right-click on a project and select 'Import'/'Export'
3. Select FTP of WebDAV and click 'Next'
--> an error message is displayed..


Best regards,
Petter Eide

Root exception:
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/team/internal/core/Sorter
at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.target.DeploymentProviderManager.<init>(DeploymentProviderManager.java:83)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.webdav.core.TeamWebDavPlugin.getDeploymentManager(TeamWebDavPlugin.java:165)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.webdav.core.TeamWebDavPlugin.startup(TeamWebDavPlugin.java:68)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.compatibility.PluginActivator.start(PluginActivator.java:31)
at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl$2.run(BundleContextImpl.java:994)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl.startActivator(BundleContextImpl.java:988)
at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl.start(BundleContextImpl.java:969)
at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleHost.startWorker(BundleHost.java:313)
at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.AbstractBundle.start(AbstractBundle.java:264)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseClassLoader.findLocalClass(EclipseClassLoader.java:116)

are gratefully accepted!

This sounds like you are using the wrong version of the download.I seem to recall that, at one point, the update site had the wrong version. You could try getting the FTP/WebDAV feature from the Eclipse.org download page for the version of Eclipse you are using.
